parameters.name: startTime
parameters.description: Earliest log date and time, default value is set to the start time of the execution. Floored to minute unit. Example: 2021-06-14T07:01:45Z

parameters.name: endTime
parameters.description: Latest log date and time, default value is set to the current time when the request is received. Floored to minute unit. Example: 2021-06-14T15:04:45Z

parameters.name: startIndex
parameters.description: Index for pagination to start with, default value is set to 0

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Number of log messages, default value is equal to 50, the maximum value is equal to 200

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Sort order (ASC, DESC) for logs by logTimestamp, default is DESC : last logs are first.

get.summary: Retrieve all workspace permissions according to search criteria
get.description:
It retrieves all workspace permissions according to several criteria:

environment : One environment of the account
workspace : One workspace of one environment of the account
user : One user of the account

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description:
The user id (Optional)
Example Value: b9e10a3f-9d68-44bb-862f-b2aa56dc7191

404.description: The environment id or the workspace id or the user id does not exist

post.description: Create sets of workspace permissions on the current system. Allows to upload list of workspace permissions to be created.Creation actions will be applied in the same order as defined in the list

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The collection of permissions to create.

204.description: All changes on Permissions were successful

207.description: Execution result detailed status on elementary changes rejected.

404.description: The workspace id or the user does not exist

put.description: Update sets of workspace permissions on the current system. Allows to upload list of workspace permissions to be updated.Update actions will be applied in the same order as defined in the list

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The collection of permissions to update.

204.description: All changes on Permissions were successful

207.description: Execution result detailed status on elementary changes rejected.

404.description: The workspace id or the user does not exist

delete.description:
Remove all permissions where user id is one from specified ones with request AND workspace is one from specified ones with request.
Special case: empty collection for users means that permissions for all users and specified workspaces will be deleted (and vise versa).

parameters.name: workspaceIds
parameters.description: Workspace ids list used to compute permission intersections with specified users.

parameters.name: userIds
parameters.description: User ids list used to compute permission intersections with specified workspaces.

204.description: All changes on Permissions were successful

207.description: Execution result detailed status on elementary changes rejected.

404.description: The workspace id or the user does not exist

get.description: Read a permission of a user on a workspace.

parameters.name: workspaceId
parameters.description: The workspace where rights will be applied. Example Value: 6089228181ef4423736e47a9

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The user for which rights will be applied. Example Value: b9e10a3f-9d68-44bb-862f-b2aa56dc7191

post.description: Create a permission of a user on a workspace.

parameters.name: workspaceId
parameters.description: The workspace where rights will be applied. Example Value: 6089228181ef4423736e47a9

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The user for which rights will be applied. Example Value: b9e10a3f-9d68-44bb-862f-b2aa56dc7191

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
Rights to add on the permission.
Example: ["AUTHOR","EXECUTE"]

403.description: Not authorized to update the permission

404.description: The workspace or the user does not exist

put.description: Update a permission of a user on a workspace.

parameters.name: workspaceId
parameters.description: The workspace where rights will be applied. Example Value: 6089228181ef4423736e47a9

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The user for which rights will be applied. Example Value: b9e10a3f-9d68-44bb-862f-b2aa56dc7191

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
Rights to update on the permission.
Example: ["AUTHOR","EXECUTE"]

403.description: Not authorized to update the permission

404.description: The permission to update doesnt exist

delete.description: Delete a permission of a user on a workspace.

parameters.name: workspaceId
parameters.description: The workspace where rights will be applied. Example Value: 6089228181ef4423736e47a9

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The user for which rights will be applied. Example Value: b9e10a3f-9d68-44bb-862f-b2aa56dc7191

404.description: The permission to delete doesnt exist

artifactType.description: Advanced Promotion Artifact Type. In the following list of allowed values, 'ACTION' refers to Artifacts, 'FLOW' refers to Tasks, 'PLAN' refers to Plans and 'WORKSPACE' refers to Workspaces

autoUpgradable.description: Indicates whether to automatically upgrade task after publishing new artifact version

overrideWithDefaultParameters.description: Indicates whether to override task parameters with artifact default parameters during auto upgrade

managed.description: Indicates whether target runtime (engine/cluster) is managed or not

checkPointFilePath.description: Checkpoint file path. Required if checkpointing enabled

BigDataRunProfile.description: Pipeline run profile of type 'Big Data'

description.description: Some description related to the usage of the scheduler

environmentId.description: Environment where this schedule will be available

trigger.description: Initial trigger to define in the schedule

environmentId.description: The environment identifier of the workspace

DataIntegrationRunProfileResponse.description: Pipeline run profile response for type 'Data-Integration'

token.description: Token (can also be provided in the Remote Engine configuration)

id.description: ID of existing cluster. Required for 'old' cluster

sparkVersion.description: Databricks runtime version. Required for 'new' cluster

nodeTypeId.description: Node type ID. Required for 'new' cluster

workersNumber.description: Number of workers. Required for 'new' cluster

day.description: Day of month to run task/plan, required only if type of schedule at days is equal to DAY_OF_MONTH

days.description: List of days of week to run task/plan, required only if type of schedule at days is equal to DAY_OF_WEEK

managed.description: Indicates whether target runtime (engine/cluster) is managed or not

clusterId.description: cluster that this engine is part of

preAuthorizedKey.description: Preauthorized key (only for not paired engine)

managed.description: Indicates whether target runtime (engine/cluster) is managed or not

esbCompatibilityVersion.description: Data Service Runner/Talend Runtime version. Mandatory if TALEND_RUNTIME or MICROSERVICE profile selected

consumed.description: Number of engines used by type

description.description: Environment description (not returned when querying a list of objects)

message.description: Error message (multilanguage). Info about error for user.

details.example: more descriptive info about something went wrong
details.description: Developer message (not translated). Info about error for developer.

url.description: URL provided detailed info about error

requestId.description: The unique identification of the request involved with this error

runtimeRunProfileId.description: tasks runtime run profile id filter

userId.description: User who triggered or scheduled the execution

userType.description: Type of user who triggered or scheduled the execution

jobVersion.description: The version of the executed job

userType.description: Type of user who triggered or scheduled the execution

jobVersion.description: The version of the executed job

scheduleId.description: Id of the schedule to associate with the task/plan

interval.description: Interval between task/plan running in days/weeks/months, required only if type of schedule is not equal to 'ONCE')

startDate.description: Date when the task should start to run/when the cron trigger is enabled

timeout.description: Execution timeout in minutes (only for tasks)

managed.description: Indicates whether target runtime (engine/cluster) is managed or not

executionPlanId.description: The plan execution identifier in case of re-execution (available from V2.4)

stepId.description: The execution step identifier (executionStepId) from which restart plan execution (available from V2.4)

rerunOnlyFailedTasks.description: Optionally run only failing tasks (available from V2.4)

planPauseDetails.description: Pause details of Plan (available from V2.6)

userId.description: User who triggered or scheduled the execution

userType.description: Type of user who triggered or scheduled the execution (HUMAN or SERVICE)

userId.description: User who triggered or scheduled the execution

userType.description: Type of user who triggered or scheduled the execution (HUMAN or SERVICE)

parallelExecutionAllowed.description: Indicates whether this executable is allowed to run in parallel (for REMOTE_ENGINE available from V2.6). 'false' by default

description.description: Promotion description (not returned when querying a list of objects)

keepTargetRunProfiles.description: Keep Target Run Profiles flag (works starting from V2.2)

userId.description: User who triggered or scheduled the execution

userType.description: Type of user who triggered or scheduled the execution

keepTargetRunProfiles.description: Keep Target Run Profiles flag (not returned for API versions earlier V2.2)

clusters.description: Remote Engine Clusters Promotion Execution Info

file.description: Boolean value which indicates that resource is file

runProfileId.description: Run profile to be used from cluster

workspaceIds.description: Workspace ids. If empty, will return events for all workspaces in the environment

limit.description: The number of items to return. Must be in range [1, 100]. Default value - 100

offset.description: The position of the first item. Must be greater than or equal to 0. Default value - 0

id.description: The entity's id for this event

sourceTriggerName.description: The source trigger's name (only for schedule for multiple triggers)

date.description: The Trigger's date for the event

type.description: The entity's type for the event

maxUsers.description: Maximum of users allowed to use the application

currentUsers.description: Count of users currently using the application

note.description: Description to rerun a plan execution from this step

enginesStatus.description: Give number of engines used by type

workspaceId.description: Workspace id of task to create

times.description: Timestamps to run task/plan, required only if type of schedule at times equal to AT_SPECIFIC_TIMES

time.description: Timestamp to run task/plan, required only if type of schedule at times equal to AT_TIME

endTime.description: Interval end timestamp, required only if type of schedule at times equal to AT_INTERVALS

interval.description: Duration of interval in minutes, required only if type of schedule at times equal to AT_INTERVALS

total.description: Number of token allowed for the account

consumed.description: Number of token currently consumed by the account

interval.description: Interval between task/plan running in days/weeks/months, required only if type of schedule is not equal to 'ONCE')

startDate.description: Date when the task should start to run/when the cron trigger is enabled

description.description: Some description related to the usage of the scheduler

triggerCalls.description: Endpoint call count to run task|plan

triggerTimeout.description: Time after which the task will starts from the moment the endpoint is first called

runAsUser.description: The user on behalf of whom the task will be launched

newUrl.description: Indicates whether to generate new url

protectedArtifactUpdate.description: Task update with workspace artifact only

initialExecutors.description: Initial number of executors (for Dynamic strategy)
